title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhengjia Wang. Copyright holder, author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wang Z (2023). rpymat: Easy Configure Isolated 'Python' Environment. https://github.com/dipterix/rpymat, http://dipterix.org/rpymat/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rpymat: Easy to Configure an Isolated 'Python' Environment},   author = {Zhengjia Wang},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/dipterix/rpymat, http://dipterix.org/rpymat/}, }

what: Easy to Configure an Isolated Python Environment
title: Easy to Configure an Isolated Python Environment
text: goal rpymat create single isolated Miniconda Python environment reproducible pipeline scripts. package shell reticulate package, provides stable behaviors, especially ‘ARM’ machines.

title: Easy to Configure an Isolated Python Environment
text: can install released version rpymat CRAN :
code: install.packages("rpymat")

title: Easy to Configure an Isolated Python Environment
text: Configure python installation Add Python conda packages
code: # change `python_ver` accordingly rpymat::configure_conda(python_ver = 'auto') # Add conda packages rpymat::add_packages(c('pandas', 'numpy'))  # Add conda packages from channels rpymat::add_packages(c('h5py'), channel = "conda-forge")  # Add pip packages rpymat::add_packages(c('sklearn'), pip = TRUE)

title: Easy to Configure an Isolated Python Environment
code: # Install Jupyterlab, will install # numpy, h5py, matplotlib, pandas,  # jupyter, jupyterlab, jupyterlab-git, ipywidgets, jupyter-server-proxy # jupyterlab_latex, jupyterlab_github, matlab_kernel rpymat::add_jupyter()  # Launch Jupyterlab rpymat::jupyter_launch(async = FALSE)

title: Easy to Configure an Isolated Python Environment
text: query existing servers stop server
code: rpymat::jupyter_launch(     async = TRUE, workdir = "~",     port = 18888, open_browser = TRUE,     token = "IwontTellYouMyToken" ) rpymat::jupyter_server_list() #>        host  port                                              token #> 1 127.0.0.1  8888 3hzWfGPa0EOmonaNS48jrTvpw07KiX7VKerA9ZTFJMkCOJMgfB #> 2 127.0.0.1 18888                                IwontTellYouMyToken rpymat::jupyter_server_stop(port = 18888)

title: Easy to Configure an Isolated Python Environment
text: run python code interactively. Alternatively, can use rpymat::run_script(path) execute Python scripts, use reticulate::py obtain results.
code: # Initialize the isolated environment  rpymat::ensure_rpymat()  rpymat::repl_python()

title: Easy to Configure an Isolated Python Environment
text: following command erase environment completely.
code: rpymat::remove_conda()

what: Choose file or directory to open via 'Python' — choose-file
title: Choose file or directory to open via 'Python' — choose-file
text: Choose directory, one multiple files open, choose file save.

title: Choose file or directory to open via 'Python' — choose-file
code: choose_fileopen(   initialfile = NULL,   multiple = FALSE,   title = ifelse(multiple, "Choose Files", "Choose a File"),   message = "",   verbose = FALSE,   force = FALSE )  choose_filesave()  choose_directory(   initialdir = NULL,   title = "Choose a Directory",   message = "",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Choose file or directory to open via 'Python' — choose-file
text: initialfile, initialdir initial selection file directory multiple whether open multiple files title, message dialogue title message verbose whether verbose debug information force whether force using 'Python' native R functions available, default false

title: Choose file or directory to open via 'Python' — choose-file
text: User-selected paths. users select nothing, NULL returned. multiple file selection, multiple paths returned.

title: Choose file or directory to open via 'Python' — choose-file
text: Base-R file.choose function choose files. However, users select multiple files directories. functions fill gap using 'Python' 'tkinter' package. Please make sure one-time setup function configure_conda executed running functions. functions must run interactive mode. run functions server, likely get nothing. functions check running interactive sessions. must check .

title: Choose file or directory to open via 'Python' — choose-file
code: if(interactive()) {   choose_fileopen(multiple = TRUE) }

title: 'Miniconda' environment — conda-env
text: functions/variables used configure 'Miniconda' environment.

title: 'Miniconda' environment — conda-env
code: CONDAENV_NAME(env_name)  conda_path()  conda_bin()  env_path()  list_pkgs(...)  configure_matlab(matlab, python_ver = "auto")  configure_conda(   python_ver = "auto",   packages = NULL,   matlab = NULL,   update = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   standalone = FALSE )  remove_conda(ask = TRUE)  add_packages(packages = NULL, python_ver = "auto", ...)  ensure_rpymat(verbose = TRUE, cache = TRUE)  matlab_engine()  call_matlab(   fun,   ...,   .options = getOption("rpymat.matlab_opt", "-nodesktop -nojvm"),   .debug = getOption("rpymat.debug", FALSE) )

title: 'Miniconda' environment — conda-env
text: env_name alternative environment name use; default "rpymat-conda-env" ... add_packages, additional parameters passing conda_install; call_matlab, ... parameters passing fun matlab 'Matlab' path add configuration path; see 'Details' python_ver python version use; see 'Configuration' packages additional python conda packages install update whether update conda; default false force whether force install 'Miniconda' even previous version exists; default false. Setting false=TRUE rarely works. Please see 'Configuration'. standalone whether install conda regardless existing conda environment ask whether ask user's agreement remove repository. parameter true functions depend remove_conda (see 'CRAN Repository Policy'). argument might removed force interactive future. verbose whether print messages cache whether use cached configurations; default true fun 'Matlab' function name, character (experimental) .options 'Matlab' compiler options .debug whether enable debug mode

title: 'Miniconda' environment — conda-env
text: None

title: 'Miniconda' environment — conda-env
text: Package reticulate provides sophisticated tool-sets allow us call python functions within R. However, installation 'Miniconda' python can tricky many platforms, example, 'M1' chip, 'ARM' machines. package rpymat provides easier approach configure machines totally isolated environments. modifications environment affect set ups. Since 2014, 'Matlab' introduced official compiler python. package rpymat provides simple approach link compiler, provided proper versions 'Matlab' installed. list 'Matlab' versions official compilers corresponding python versions.

title: 'Miniconda' environment — conda-env
text: 'Matlab' compiler installed, cases, function configure_conda default arguments automatically downloads latest 'Miniconda' configures latest python. versions 'Miniconda' installed, please set options "reticulate.miniconda.url" change source location. 'Matlab' installed, please specify 'Matlab' path running configure_conda. environment setup, configure_matlab can link 'Matlab' compilers without removing existing environment. 'ARM' users, unfortunately, 'Matlab' support compilers written 'Intel' chips.

title: 'Miniconda' environment — conda-env
text: conda python environment installed, make sure run ensure_rpymat() running python code. function make sure correct compiler linked current R session.

title: 'Miniconda' environment — conda-env
code: # The script will interactively install \code{conda} to `R_user_dir` if (FALSE) {  # Install conda and python 3.9  configure_conda(python_ver = '3.9')   # Add packages h5py, pandas, jupyter  add_packages(c('h5py', 'pandas', 'jupyter'))  # Add pip packages  add_packages("itk", pip = TRUE)  # Initialize the isolated environment  ensure_rpymat()   # Remove the environment  remove_conda()  }

what: Install, register, launch 'Jupyter' notebook to the virtual environment — jupyter
title: Install, register, launch 'Jupyter' notebook to the virtual environment — jupyter
text: Install, register, launch 'Jupyter' notebook virtual environment

title: Install, register, launch 'Jupyter' notebook to the virtual environment — jupyter
code: add_jupyter(..., register_R = TRUE)  jupyter_bin()  jupyter_register_R(   user = NULL,   name = "ir",   displayname = "R",   rprofile = NULL,   prefix = NULL,   sys_prefix = NULL,   verbose = getOption("verbose") )  jupyter_options(   root_dir,   host = "127.0.0.1",   port = 8888,   open_browser = FALSE,   token = rand_string() )  jupyter_launch(   host = "127.0.0.1",   port = 8888,   open_browser = TRUE,   workdir = getwd(),   async = FALSE,   ...,   dry_run = FALSE )  jupyter_check_launch(   port = 8888,   host = "127.0.0.1",   open_browser = TRUE,   workdir = getwd(),   async = "auto",   ... )  jupyter_server_list()  jupyter_server_stop(port, ...)  jupyter_server_stop_all(...)

title: Install, register, launch 'Jupyter' notebook to the virtual environment — jupyter
text: ... add_jupyter, additional parameters passed jupyter_register_R; jupyter_launch, additional parameters passed jupyter_options register_R whether register IRkernel notebook user, name, displayname, rprofile, prefix, sys_prefix, verbose see installspec root_dir, workdir default root directory notebook host, port 'IP' port hosting 'URL' open_browser whether open browser launched token access token notebook async whether open notebook background dry_run whether display command instead executing ; used debug code

title: Install, register, launch 'Jupyter' notebook to the virtual environment — jupyter
text: jupyter_bin returns 'Jupyter' notebook binary path; jupyter_options returns 'Jupyter' configuration strings; jupyter_server_list returns table existing local 'Jupyter' server hosts, ports, tokens; jupyter_check_launch returns true new server created, false existing server port; functions return nothing.

title: Install, register, launch 'Jupyter' notebook to the virtual environment — jupyter
code: if (FALSE) {  # Requires installation of conda library(rpymat)  # Install conda, if you have done so, skip configure_conda()   # Install Jupyter notebook add_jupyter(register_R = TRUE)   # Utility functions jupyter_bin()  # Please install `dipsaus` package to enable `async=TRUE` with # better experience jupyter_launch(async = FALSE, open_browser = TRUE)   }

title: Get 'Python' built-in object — py_builtin
text: Get 'Python' built-object

title: Get 'Python' built-in object — py_builtin
code: py_builtin(name, convert = FALSE)

title: Get 'Python' built-in object — py_builtin
text: name object name convert see import_builtins

title: Get 'Python' built-in object — py_builtin
text: python built-object specified name

title: Get 'Python' built-in object — py_builtin
code: if(interactive() && ants_available()) {   # ------ Basic case: use python `int` as an R function --------- py_int <- py_builtin("int")  # a is an R object now a <- py_int(9) print(a) class(a)  # ------ Use python `int` as a Python function ----------------- py_int2 <- py_builtin("int", convert = FALSE)  # b in a python object b <- py_int2(9)  # There is no '[1] ' when printing print(b) class(b)  # convert to R object py_to_r(b)    }

title: List in 'Python' — py_list
text: List 'Python'

title: List in 'Python' — py_list
code: py_list(..., convert = FALSE)

title: List in 'Python' — py_list
text: ... passing list ('Python') convert whether convert results back R; default

title: List in 'Python' — py_list
text: List instance, R vector converted

title: List in 'Python' — py_list
code: if(interactive() && ants_available()) {    py_list(list(1,2,3))   py_list(c(1,2,3))    py_list(array(1:9, c(3,3)))   py_list(list(list(1:3), letters[1:3]))  }

title: Slice index in 'Python' arrays — py_slice
text: Slice index 'Python' arrays

title: Slice index in 'Python' arrays — py_slice
code: py_slice(...)

title: Slice index in 'Python' arrays — py_slice
text: ... passing slice ('Python')

title: Slice index in 'Python' arrays — py_slice
text: Index slice instance

title: Slice index in 'Python' arrays — py_slice
code: if(interactive() && ants_available()) {    x <- np_array(array(seq(20), c(4, 5)))    # equivalent to x[::2]   x[py_slice(NULL, NULL, 2L)]  }

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. glue glue

title: Enable interactive 'python' from R — repl_python
text: Allows users type 'python' command R console quick code evaluation debugging.

title: Enable interactive 'python' from R — repl_python
code: repl_python(...)

title: Enable interactive 'python' from R — repl_python
text: ... passed repl_python 'reticulate' package

title: Enable interactive 'python' from R — repl_python
text: See repl_python

title: Wrappers around 'reticulate' package — reticulate-reexports
text: Almost 'reticulate' functions, rpymat enabled default minor changes (see parameter convert local)

title: Wrappers around 'reticulate' package — reticulate-reexports
code: import_main(convert = FALSE)  tuple(..., convert = FALSE)  py_tuple(..., convert = FALSE)  py_help(object)  np_array(data, ...)  import(module, as = NULL, convert = FALSE, delay_load = FALSE)  r_to_py(x, convert = FALSE)  py_to_r(x)  py_to_r_wrapper(x)  py_str(object, ...)  py_run_string(code, local = TRUE, convert = FALSE)  py_bool(x)  py_dict(keys, values, convert = FALSE)  py_call(x, ...)  py_del_attr(x, name)  py_del_item(x, name)  py_eval(code, convert = FALSE)  py_get_attr(x, name, silent = FALSE)  py_set_attr(x, name, value)  py_get_item(x, key, silent = FALSE)  py_set_item(x, name, value)  py_len(x, default = NULL)  py_none()

title: Wrappers around 'reticulate' package — reticulate-reexports
text: convert whether convert 'Python' objects R; default FALSE. different 'reticulate', less error prone: users must explicitly convert 'Python' objects R. object, data, x, code, keys, values, ... passed corresponding 'reticulate' functions data inputs module, , delay_load import 'Python' module alias local whether execute code locally memory sets free function ends; default true name, silent, key, value, default parameters passing 'reticulate' functions

title: Wrappers around 'reticulate' package — reticulate-reexports
text: 'Python' built-objects

title: Wrappers around 'reticulate' package — reticulate-reexports
code: library(rpymat) if(interactive() && dir.exists(env_path())) {    # tuple   x <- tuple(1, 2, "a")   print(x)    # convert to R object   py_to_r(x)    # convert R object to python   y <- r_to_py(list(a = 1, b = "s"))    # get element   py_get_item(y, "a")    # get missing element   py_get_item(y, "c", silent = TRUE)  }

title: Get 'Python' main process environment — rpymat-python-main
text: py automatically converts 'Python' objects R objects. import_main convert default; see 'Examples' details.

title: Get 'Python' main process environment — rpymat-python-main
code: py

title: Get 'Python' main process environment — rpymat-python-main
text: object class NULL length 0.

title: Get 'Python' main process environment — rpymat-python-main
text: 'Python' main process module

title: Get 'Python' main process environment — rpymat-python-main
code: py_no_convert <- rpymat::import_main(convert = FALSE) #> * Installing Miniconda -- please wait a moment ... #> * Downloading 'https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh' ... #> + '/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/bin/conda' 'create' '--yes' '--name' 'r-reticulate' 'python=3.9' 'numpy' '--quiet' '-c' 'conda-forge' #> * Miniconda has been successfully installed at "~/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda". #> + '/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/bin/conda' 'create' '--yes' '--prefix' '/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/envs/rpymat-conda-env' 'python=3.9' '--quiet' '-c' 'conda-forge' #> + '/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/bin/conda' 'install' '--yes' '--prefix' '/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/envs/rpymat-conda-env' '-c' 'conda-forge' 'numpy'  py$a <- matrix(seq_len(16), 4)  py_no_convert$a #> array([[ 1,  5,  9, 13], #>        [ 2,  6, 10, 14], #>        [ 3,  7, 11, 15], #>        [ 4,  8, 12, 16]], dtype=int32)  py$a #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] #> [1,]    1    5    9   13 #> [2,]    2    6   10   14 #> [3,]    3    7   11   15 #> [4,]    4    8   12   16

what: Execute command with additional environments — run_command
title: Execute command with additional environments — run_command
text: Enables 'conda' environment

title: Execute command with additional environments — run_command
code: cmd_create(command, shell, use_glue = TRUE)  cmd_set_env(command, key, value, quote = TRUE, quote_type = "cmd")  cmd_set_workdir(command, workdir)  cmd_set_conda(command, conda_path, env_path)  cmd_build(command, .env = parent.frame(), ...)  detect_shell(suggest = NULL)  run_command(   command,   shell = detect_shell(),   use_glue = FALSE,   enable_conda = TRUE,   stdout = "",   stderr = "",   stdin = "",   input = NULL,   env_list = list(),   wait = TRUE,   timeout = 0,   ...,   workdir = getwd(),   dry_run = FALSE,   print_cmd = dry_run,   glue_env = parent.frame() )

title: Execute command with additional environments — run_command
text: command system command shell shell type use_glue whether glue command; default false key, value environment variable key value quote, quote_type whether quote environment variables quote type use; see shQuote workdir working directory conda_path 'conda' path; default conda_path env_path 'conda' environment path; default env_path suggest suggested shell type; default 'cmd' windows, 'bash' others enable_conda whether activate 'conda' stdout, stderr, stdin, input, wait, timeout, ... passed system2 env_list key-value pairs environment variables dry_run whether dry-run command (execute, simply returns command), useful debug print_cmd whether print command glue_env, .env environment evaluate variables use_glue true

title: Execute command with additional environments — run_command
text: functions return list class rpymat_system_command except run_command, returns exit code system2.

title: Execute command with additional environments — run_command
code: run_command("conda install -y numpy", dry_run = TRUE) #> Warning: path[1]="/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/condabin/conda/../..": Not a directory #> #!/usr/bin/env bash #> cd '/home/runner/work/rpymat/rpymat/docs/reference' #> if [ -f "/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/condabin/conda/../../etc/profile.d/conda.sh" ]; then #>   . "/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/condabin/conda/../../etc/profile.d/conda.sh" #> else #>   export PATH="/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/condabin/conda/../../bin:$PATH" #> fi #>  #> conda activate "/home/runner/.local/share/r-rpymat/miniconda/envs/rpymat-conda-env" #> cd '/home/runner/work/rpymat/rpymat/docs/reference' #>  #>  #> conda install -y numpy   a <- "This is a message" run_command('echo "{a}"', dry_run = TRUE,             enable_conda = FALSE, use_glue = TRUE) #> #!/usr/bin/env bash #> cd '/home/runner/work/rpymat/rpymat/docs/reference' #> cd '/home/runner/work/rpymat/rpymat/docs/reference' #>  #>  #> echo "This is a message"   if (FALSE) {  # Use `jupyter_launch()` instead. This is just a demonstration run_command('"{jupyter_bin()}" server list', use_glue = TRUE)  }

title: Run 'Python' script — run_pyscript
text: wrapper py_run_file, rpymat enabled

title: Run 'Python' script — run_pyscript
code: run_script(   x,   work_dir = NULL,   local = FALSE,   convert = FALSE,   globals = list() )  run_pyscript(   x,   work_dir = NULL,   local = FALSE,   convert = FALSE,   globals = list() )  run_pystring(   code,   work_dir = NULL,   local = FALSE,   convert = FALSE,   globals = list() )

title: Run 'Python' script — run_pyscript
text: x 'Python' script path work_dir working directory script local, convert passed py_run_file globals named list global R variables used 'Python' script code 'Python' code

title: Run 'Python' script — run_pyscript
text: values returned py_run_file

title: Run 'Python' script — run_pyscript
code: if (FALSE) {  # Please configure conda environment first  x <- tempfile() writeLines(c(   "import re",   "zipcode = re.findall(r'[0-9]{5,6}', r.address)" ), con = x)  address <- '2341 Main St., 72381' rpymat::run_script(x)  py$zipcode  }

title: rpymat 0.1.6
text: Fixed installation problem introduced version 0.1.5 Added utility functions basic Python types Added global variables run_pyscript

title: rpymat 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-04 Added choose_directory, choose_fileopen, choose_filesave select files using either base R Python (via tcl-tk better interface osx) Ported reticulate functions convert R Python objects Allowed set conda installed version via system environment R_RPYMAT_CONDA_EXE R_RPYMAT_CONDA_PREFIX; change allow conda-forge library r-rpymat use already-installed conda Speed-ensure_rpymat caching configuration

title: rpymat 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-01-21 Muffled conda information running Python code scripts Ported reticulate::repl_python function Allowed users list installed packages Allowed jupyter run background RStudio jobs Removed optional jupyter add-packages installation script

title: rpymat 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-06 Fixed command-line script failing load conda Allowed use miniconda installed user’s home directory Use slash instead backslash Windows system avoid escaping issues

title: rpymat 0.1.2

title: rpymat 0.1.1
